entry.name: The Haemophilus ducreyi LspA1 Protein Inhibits Phagocytosis By Using a New Mechanism Involving Activation of C-Terminal Src Kinase
entry.description: LspA virulance factors of H. ducreyi inhibit phagocytosis by activating C-terminal Src kinase. This SILAC analysis identified Src kinase as the predominant mamallian protein interacting with the YL2 domain of LspA1.

additional_fields.field: A SILAC IP experiment was performed using unlabelled HEK293T cells expressing a control L1-Myc construct, and heavy labelled cells expressing YL2-Myc. An anti-Myc IP was performed to pull down interacting proteins. Proteins interacting specifically with the YL2 domain will have high Heavy:Light SILAC ratios. After IP, proteins were run into the top of an SDS-PAGE gel, excised and digested with trypsin. Peptide mixtures were analyzed using a 40min reverse-phase gradient on an Orbitrap Elite mass-spectrometer coupled to a Dionex U3000 RSLCnano system. The column was 180um ID x 10cm, packed in-house with 3um C18 resin (Phenomenex).

LC-MS/MS data was analyzed using MaxQuant 1.3.0.5 with default parameters except that Ile-Leu equivalence was disabled. The UniProtKB Human whole proteome sequence database (2012_04) was used for peptide and protein ID.
Affinity purification coupled with mass spectrometry proteomics

Dodd DA, Worth RG, Rosen MK, Grinstein S, van Oers NS, Hansen EJ. The Haemophilus ducreyi LspA1 protein inhibits phagocytosis by using a new mechanism involving activation of C-terminal Src kinase. MBio. 2014 May 20;5(3):e01178-14
Department of Microbiology, The University of Texas Southwestern Medical School, Dallas, Texas, USA.
